channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Don't Wait for the Next Big Data Breach to Freeze Your Credit
item.description: Freezing your credit is a simple and free protection from identity thieves with few downsides.

item.title: Gap beats earnings and revenue estimates, hikes profit margin outlook as results are posted early
item.description: Gap beat earnings and revenue estimates, as it posted its fiscal second-quarter results early.

item.title: Nestlé Has the Right Recipe
item.description: The global food giant’s drama at the top obscures a solid strategy and cheap shares.

item.title: Ulta misses Wall Street expectations first time in 4 years, trims guidance after quarterly sales decline
item.description: Comparable sales for the second quarter fell 1.2%, compared to an 8% increase a year earlier.

item.title: Budget Airlines Want to Go Premium. That's Easier Said Than Done.
item.description: Floundering low-cost carriers are trying to appeal to higher spenders—but pivoting away from a no-frills brand comes with perils.

item.title: MongoDB shares surge 13% on guidance boost
item.description: MongoDB delivered stronger results than analysts had been looking for, partly because of better cloud consumption activity than expected.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: Lululemon cuts guidance, misses sales estimates after botched product launch
item.description: Lululemon's growth in its largest market, the Americas, has slowed from the highs it saw last year as it contends with product rollout challenges.

item.title: The Alleged Kickback Schemes That Inflated Costs for Home Buyers
item.description: The District of Columbia settled with four title companies over close ties with real-estate agents.

item.title: Nvidia shares fall despite earnings beating estimates
item.description: Nvidia shares fell on Thursday despite its fiscal second-quarter results beating estimates.
